intro: Psilostrophe mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive, lance-shaped appearance. Psilostrophe mexicana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
